New Records: Patson Daka scored a late equaliser to salvage a 1-1 draw for 10-man Zambia, denying opponents Tanzania a first Group F win at the Africa Cup of Nations.
Key Match Events: Simon Msuva's 11th minute strike handed Tanzania the lead
Patson Daka's explosive header in the 88th minute ensured a share of the spoils
Pre-Game Insights: Tanzania had failed to win on their previous finals appearances in 1980 and 2019
Coach Adel Amrouche was handed an eight-match suspension on Friday
Post-Match Reflections: Sunday's results left Morocco top with four points, the Congolese and Zambians on two points and Tanzania bottom on one, after two games each
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at the Laurent Pokou Stadium in San-Pedro, Ivory Coast with an attendance of 13,342
Others: Zambia was reduced to 10 men after a red card in the game
